info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 29 at 4:31PM EDT until August 29 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES... At 431 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Leechburg, or near Vandergrift, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Vandergrift, Apollo, Murrysville, Ford City, Leechburg, North Apollo, West Leechburg, Orchard Hills, Oklahoma, East Vandergrift, Hyde Park, and North Vandergrift. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
